value.title: One Click Calculation Group in Power BI
value.excerpt: Calculation Groups in Power BI can be amazing! Patrick shows you how you can create these common patterns with just one click using Tabular Editor.  Blog: https://www.esbrina-ba.com/time-intelligence-the-smart-way/  Calculation Groups: https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/calculation-groups?view=asallproducts-allversions

value.title: Paginated URL Parameters
value.excerpt: Adam shows you how Power BI Paginated URL Parameters can help to export data beyond 150,000 rows in Power BI reports. value.title: Power BI DirectQuery and SQL Databases: A Conversation with Bob Ward

value.title: Power BI for the NON-TECHnical person
value.excerpt: Is Power BI intimidating? Coming from Microsoft Excel? You consider yourself non-technical? Don't want to have to write or know anything about DAX? Patrick looks at how you can create a report quickly with just your Excel data and not have to write any code!  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present
